snippet: Hiram Monserrate, a former city councilman, asked the Council for discretionary funds for a nonprofit organization, and used some of the money to benefit his campaign.
abstract: Hiram Monserrate, former New York City councilman and state senator, pleads guilty to improperly using City Council money to finance a failed political campaign. (M)
lead_paragraph: Hiram Monserrate, a former city councilman and state senator, pleaded guilty on Friday to improperly using Council money to finance a failed political campaign. Mr. Monserrate, a Democrat, represented a Queens district in the State Senate before he was expelled in 2010. On Friday, he acknowledged before Judge Colleen McMahon in Federal District Court in Manhattan that he was guilty of mail fraud and mail fraud conspiracy.

headline.main: Monserrate Pleads Guilty To the Misuse of City Funds
